page.title: 10E.E.C. SUBSIDIES -WILLOUGHBY
page.content:
The farmers of Willoughby who keep dairy cows have been affected a lot by the E.E.C.'s Common Agricultural Policy. There is a big milk surplus in Europe. So the E.E.C. wants to stop farmers producing milk if possible. It does this by a variety of subsidies.
For example, one farmer in Willoughby, has a large herd of Guernsey dairy cattle. However, he will be paid 8p for every pint of milk he would have produced if he gets rid of these. So he is going to sell them, and turn to beef production instead.
This will mean the cows no longer go through the village every morning and evening to be milked, removing one part of the village's atmosphere.
